metaTitle: 2 Bed Town House Fuente Álamo €199,250 - Costa Blanca
metaDescription: Stylish 2-bedroom town house in Fuente Álamo, Costa Blanca. €199,250. Premium specification, 40% less than Spanish islands. Ideal holiday home.
heroIntro: Imagine waking up to Mediterranean sunshine in your own holiday home on Spain's Costa Blanca. This beautifully appointed 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom town house in Fuente Álamo offers the perfect Mediterranean escape at just €199,250—exceptional value when you consider it's 40% less expensive than comparable properties on Spanish island markets. With 70m² of thoughtfully designed living space and a 133m² plot, this isn't just a property investment; it's your gateway to year-round sunshine and coastal relaxation. Whether you're seeking a sunshine retreat for getaways with family and friends, or a second home that generates rental income during peak seasons (typically €800 per week), this town house delivers both lifestyle and financial returns. The established expat community in Fuente Álamo means you'll find English spoken widely, familiar amenities, and a welcoming international network. Located just 20 minutes from pristine Blue Flag beaches and surrounded by championship golf courses, restaurants, and Mediterranean culture, this is where your holiday home dreams become reality.
areaSection: Fuente Álamo is a charming town nestled in the heart of Murcia, blessed with over 300 days of annual sunshine and a temperate Mediterranean climate perfect for year-round enjoyment. Just 20 minutes from the stunning Costa Blanca coastline, this strategic location offers the best of both worlds—proximity to beaches without the tourist crowds and higher prices of beachfront communities. The town sits at the crossroads of accessibility, with Alicante airport just 45 minutes away and regional services within easy reach. Fuente Álamo has undergone significant development in recent years, with new residential communities attracting international buyers seeking authentic Spanish lifestyle combined with modern amenities. The surrounding region offers dramatic coastal scenery, salt lakes, and pine forests, making it ideal for those who appreciate nature alongside Mediterranean leisure.
lifestyleSection: Life in Fuente Álamo as a holiday home owner is wonderfully relaxed. Mornings might start at a local café with cortado and churros, followed by a visit to the weekly market for fresh produce and local specialties. The town's supermarkets—Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum—stock everything you need, while authentic Spanish restaurants serve regional dishes at reasonable prices. You'll quickly discover that the established expat community creates a genuine sense of belonging; English is widely spoken in shops, restaurants, and among neighbors. Afternoons invite leisurely exploration of nearby beaches, water sports, or rounds at championship golf courses. The healthcare system is excellent, with English-speaking doctors and private clinics readily available. Shopping is convenient with local markets offering fresh seafood and produce, while modern shopping centers are nearby for international brands. Public transport connects the town, though a rental car provides flexibility for beach days and exploring the wider Costa Blanca region.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Fuente Álamo punches above its weight for convenience. Daily necessities, healthcare, education, and entertainment are all accessible, making life as a holiday homeowner surprisingly effortless. The town balances Spanish authenticity with international amenities.

healthcare.text: Healthcare access is excellent and reassuring for international property owners. The Regional Hospital Virgen del Castillo (28km) is a modern facility with emergency services, English-speaking doctors, and comprehensive departments. Private clinics throughout the region cater specifically to expatriates, with many doctors trained in UK or North American systems. Fuente Álamo itself has health centers providing basic services and prescription medications. Dental care is widely available and significantly cheaper than UK or Northern European prices. Most international residents arrange private health insurance, which is affordable and covers both routine care and emergencies. Pharmacies (farmacias) are abundant and many English-speaking pharmacists can advise on minor ailments.

education.text: Education options range from local Spanish schools to international alternatives. Universities in Murcia and Valencia are easily accessible for higher education. Most international families find education planning straightforward given the diverse options available.

shopping.text: Shopping in Fuente Álamo caters to all needs and budgets. Mercadona is the primary supermarket chain with excellent fresh produce sections, seafood counters, and Spanish specialties. Lidl and Consum offer competitive pricing and international products. The weekly market (mercado) provides authentic Spanish shopping—fresh fish, vegetables, local cheeses, and regional products at genuine prices. For larger shopping trips, the nearby mall offers international brands, clothing, and electronics. Farm shops sell directly from local producers. Online shopping through Spanish retailers is straightforward for items you can't find locally. British expat favorites are stocked in specialty shops serving the international community.

transport.text: Getting around from Fuente Álamo is straightforward. Alicante-Elche Airport (45km) offers direct flights to UK, Northern Europe, and major Spanish cities—perfect for regular holiday visits. Bus connections link to nearby towns and the coast, though a rental car provides superior flexibility for beach days, exploration, and dining out. Driving standards are reasonable, fuel is cheaper than UK, and car rental for holiday periods is inexpensive. The town itself is compact and walkable for daily amenities. Roads are modern and well-maintained. Parking is rarely problematic in residential areas.

faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-EU and non-Spanish nationals can purchase property without restrictions. You'll need a Spanish NIE (tax identification number), complete standard conveyancing through a Spanish notary, and pay typical transfer taxes (6-10%). The process takes 4-6 weeks with proper legal representation. Most international buyers use English-speaking Spanish lawyers to guide them through purchase, which costs €1,000-1,500.

faqs.question: Is Costa Blanca a good place to buy property?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is excellent for property investment and holiday homes. The region offers consistent property appreciation, strong international rental demand, established expat communities, and Mediterranean lifestyle advantages. Fuente Álamo specifically benefits from rising development, improved infrastructure, and proximity to beaches and amenities—attracting serious buyers seeking authentic Spanish living with modern convenience.

faqs.question: What is the rental income potential for this property?
faqs.answer: This town house typically generates €800 per week as a holiday rental—€3,200 monthly during peak season (Easter, summer, Christmas). Over a conservative 20-week rental season, this yields €16,000 annually, providing an 8% gross return. Many owners achieve 24-28 weeks of bookings, increasing returns significantly. Professional holiday rental management companies handle marketing, cleaning, and guest communication for 25-30% commission.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Total acquisition costs typically run 6-10% of purchase price. Transfer tax (ITP) is 6%, notary fees around €800-1,200, property registration roughly €400, and legal fees €1,000-1,500. For this €199,250 property, expect total costs of €12,000-20,000. Mortgage lenders in Spain require 20-30% down payment, meaning foreign buyers often pay lower overall costs than first-time buyers in UK markets.

faqs.question: Can I get a mortgage in Spain as a foreigner?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers regularly obtain Spanish mortgages. Most major Spanish banks (BBVA, Santander, CaixaBank) lend to non-residents. You'll need proof of income, a NIE (tax identification number), and typically provide 30% down payment. Interest rates are competitive (2-3% fixed for 20-year terms). Spanish mortgages offer advantages over refinancing with UK lenders, particularly regarding currency stability and Spanish property asset protection.

faqs.question: How far is Costa Blanca from the United Kingdom?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport, just 45km from Fuente Álamo, has direct flights to UK airports (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol, Edinburgh) with journey times of 2-3 hours. Budget airlines like Ryanair and easyJet operate frequent routes at reasonable fares (often €30-80 return flights), making weekend and holiday visits practical and affordable. From Murcia airport, some regional flights also serve UK destinations.

faqs.question: What is the weather like on Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 300+ days of annual sunshine. Winters are mild (12-16°C) with occasional rain, summers warm to hot (28-32°C) with minimal precipitation, and autumn/spring perfect at 18-24°C. This makes Fuente Álamo ideal for year-round holiday homes—beach swimming from May through October, pleasant outdoor living November through April. Unlike UK weather unpredictability, Costa Blanca offers reliable sunshine for planning holidays and outdoor activities.

faqs.question: Is Costa Blanca good for retirees?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca ranks among Europe's top retirement destinations. Cost of living is 20-30% lower than UK, healthcare is excellent with English-speaking doctors, and established expat communities provide immediate social networks. Fuente Álamo specifically appeals to retirees seeking affordable Mediterranean living with modern amenities, good healthcare access, and proximity to beaches. Many retirees purchase at this price point as affordable, appreciating primary residences or investment properties.

faqs.question: How quickly can I complete the purchase?
faqs.answer: Timeline typically spans 4-8 weeks from offer acceptance to completion. Steps include: offer and acceptance (1 week), legal review and NIE acquisition (1-2 weeks), mortgage arrangement if needed (2-3 weeks), final inspections and documentation (1 week), notary appointment and funds transfer (1 week). Expedited purchases are possible with cash and straightforward conveyancing, sometimes completing within 3-4 weeks.
